intro: Scrophularia teucrium, commonly known as common scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tubular, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have serrated edges. Scrophularia teucrium is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in open woodlands.
